title: Noa Noa (Fragrant), from the Noa Noa Suite

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of wood-block print in black, with a transferred twill impression, on tan wove paper.

medium_display: Wood-block print in black, with a transferred twill impression, on tan wove paper
inscriptions: Monogrammed upper center, in image: "P G O"
credit_line: Gift of the Print and Drawing Club
publication_history:
Charles Morice, Paul Gauguin (H. Floury, 1920), p. 131 (ill.).

Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 16 (ill.).

Musée du Luxembourg, Gauguin: Sculpteur et graveur, exh. cat. (Musée du Luxembourg, 1928), p. 11, cat. 59.

Robert Rey, “Paul Gauguin graveur,” Byblis 7 (A. Morancé, 1928), p. 42 (ill.).

Raymond Cogniat, La vie ardente de Paul Gauguin, with a preface by Henri Focillon, exh. cat. (Gazette des Beaux-Arts, 1936), p. 89, cat. 146b.

Carl O. Schniewind, “Two Woodcuts by Paul Gauguin,” Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 24 (Dec. 1940), p. 112 (ill.).

Lorenzo Varela, trans., Noa Noa: La isla feliz (Poseidon, 1942), p. 17 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin Prints (Art Institute of Chicago, 1959), n.pag. (ill.).

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 50, cat. 13.

Richard R. Brettell, Françoise Cachin, Claire Frèches-Thory, and Charles F. Stuckey, The Art of Paul Gauguin, with assistance from Peter Zegers, exh. cat. (National Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C./Art Institute of Chicago/New York Graphic Society Books, 1988), p. 293, fig. 73 (ill.).

Pushkin State Museum of Fine Arts, Gogen, exh. cat. (Sov. Khudozhnik, 1989), p. 145 (ill.).

Nancy Mowll Mathews, Paul Gauguin: An Erotic Life (Yale University Press, 2001), p. 191, fig. 60 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Paris, Musée du Luxembourg, "Gauguin: Sculpteur et Graveur," January–February, 1928, p. 11, cat. 59.

Gazette des Beaux-Arts, Paris, La vie ardente de Paul Gauguin, 1936, cat. 146b.

Brooklyn Museum, "Complete Graphic Works & Some Paintings by Gauguin," June 18-September 18, 1938, no exh cat.
provenance_text: Charles Morice (1860-1919), Paris [Kornfeld 1988].  Marcel Guérin (1873-1948), Paris [Lugt 1872b on original mount] by 1928 [Paris, 1928]. Jean Goriany by 1938 [Brooklyn Museum 1938], New York, sold to the Art Institute, 1940.

input: Noa Noa (Fragrant), from the Noa Noa Suite
